Highlights

  • Sophos Launches Workspace Protection to Secure Hybrid and Remote Work Environments (Published 2026-01-20)

    Sophos has introduced its new Workspace Protection solution to address security risks in hybrid and remote working models. With AI-driven adaptive defense features, this release elevates security expectations for distributed SaaS platforms—including cloud-based HR applications like Workday. For Workday clients, robust cross-domain security must now be deeply integrated with HR process automation, highlighting a critical conversation around secure-by-design transformation efforts.
    Read more

  • Docebo Acquires 365Talents to Expand AI-driven Skills Intelligence (Published 2026-01-20)

    Docebo’s acquisition of 365Talents brings advanced AI-powered skill mapping and matching to its learning platform—a direct competitive challenge to Workday’s Skills Cloud. This move underscores the rising strategic importance of embedded, autonomous skills intelligence for talent management. Deloitte must actively differentiate Workday’s native offerings while developing readiness for integration scenarios where clients adopt multiple AI-driven skills platforms.
    Read more

  • e& and IBM Announce Enterprise-Grade Agentic AI for Governance and Compliance (Published 2026-01-19)

    IBM and e&’s partnership to launch enterprise-grade agentic AI solutions tuned for governance, risk, and compliance elevates industry focus on responsible adoption of autonomous AI. These offerings are tailored for organizations in heavily regulated domains—many of whom rely on platforms like Workday. This reinforces the urgency for proactive, demonstrable responsible AI practices within Deloitte’s advisory and implementation offerings.
    Read more

Competitive Watch

  • Docebo: Acquisition of 365Talents strengthens skills intelligence capabilities and raises the bar for AI-driven HR solutions. Deloitte must support clients with comparative analyses and integration strategies for Skills Cloud and competing offerings.
  • IBM: Focuses on responsible, compliant agentic AI in its new enterprise offerings, targeting Workday’s regulated industry clients. Deloitte should emphasize responsible AI and compliance enablement in all Workday transformation programs.
  • Sophos: Emphasizes security for hybrid and remote cloud environments, compelling Workday practitioners to integrate adaptive security into HR transformation discussions.

Enablement

  • Workday Skills Cloud Capabilities: Learn more
  • Responsible AI Governance in Enterprise SaaS: View details
  • Securing Distributed and Hybrid Work: Latest insights

Actions for Next Week

  • Update advisory collateral on AI skills intelligence and integration options with third-party solutions.
  • Coordinate internal workshops on responsible agentic AI governance and risk.
  • Partner with platform security teams to ensure hybrid work risk scenarios are covered in ongoing client work.
  • Refresh enablement for Deloitte Workday teams on AI, security, and skills intelligence market shifts.

Risks & Mitigations

  • Competitive Erosion in Skills Intelligence: Mitigate by proactively differentiating and integrating Workday Skills Cloud.
  • Compliance Gaps with Autonomous AI: Counter through embedded responsible AI assessment and controls in every program.
  • Security Vulnerabilities in Hybrid Models: Address by incorporating adaptive endpoint protection in all client solutions.

All Sources

  • Sophos introduces Workspace Protection
  • Docebo Acquires 365Talents
  • e& and IBM Unveil Agentic AI
  • Workday Skills Cloud
  • Workday & HiredScore: Compliance and Bias Mitigation

Return JSON ONLY in this exact shape (no code fences, no extra text):

{
  "type": "daily or weekly",
  "run_date": "YYYY-MM-DD",
  "title": "Short headline",
  "priority_focus": "1–2 sentences on what matters most now",
  "highlights": [
    { "headline": "…", "why_it_matters": "…", "source_url": "https://…" }
  ],
  "competitive_watch": [
    { "competitor": "Name", "move": "…", "implication": "…" }
  ],
  "enablement": [
    { "skill": "Topic", "resource_url": "https://…", "90_day_outcome": "…" }
  ],
  "actions_next_week": ["…"],
  "risks": [
    { "risk": "…", "mitigation": "…" }
  ],
  "sources": [
    { "title": "…", "url": "https://…" }
  ],
  "html_body": "<h2>…</h2> (well-formatted HTML with <a href="https://…">links</a>; no scripts/external CSS)",
  "plain_text_body": "Text-only with visible URLs"
}

Parameters:
- Set "run_date" to TODAY_ET = 2026-01-20.
- For DAILY: set "type":"daily"; target ~1000 words; STRICTLY restrict to the last 24 hours (from 2026-01-19T06:44 to 2026-01-20T06:44); include publication dates in highlight text.
- For WEEKLY: set "type":"weekly"; target 2000–2500 words; restrict to 2026-01-13…2026-01-20; include <h3>What changed this week</h3> and publication dates in highlight text.
- Section order for html_body: Highlights; Competitive Watch; Enablement; Actions for Next Week; Risks & Mitigations; All Sources.
- Every item must include at least one absolute URL (https://…).
- Keep total HTML under ~25KB.

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS
- For every highlight and competitive_watch item, include a 2–3 paragraph detailed summary within the "why_it_matters" text.
- Where relevant, compare perspectives across multiple sources.
- Include a clear "so what" statement for Deloitte’s Workday practice.
- Ensure all cited URLs appear in the `sources` array and inside the `html_body` link text.
- Keep factual accuracy and avoid speculation.

security, and skills intelligence market shifts.</li>\\n</ul>\\n<h2>Risks & Mitigations</h2>\\n<ul>\\n  <li><b>Competitive Erosion in Skills Intelligence:</b> Mitigate by proactively differentiating and integrating Workday Skills Cloud.</li>\\n  <li><b>Compliance Gaps with Autonomous AI:</b> Counter through embedded responsible AI assessment and controls in every program.</li>\\n  <li><b>Security Vulnerabilities in Hybrid Models:</b> Address by incorporating adaptive endpoint protection in all client solutions.</li>\\n</ul>\\n<h2>All Sources</h2>\\n<ul>\\n  <li><a href=\\\"https://siliconangle.com/2026/01/20/sophos-introduces-workspace-protection-simplify-hybrid-remote-work-security\\\">Sophos introduces Workspace Protection</a></li>\\n  <li><a href=\\\"https://newsroom.ibm.com/2026-01-19-e-and-ibm-unveil-enterprise-grade-agentic-AI-to-transform-governance-and-compliance\\\">e& and IBM Unveil Agentic AI</a></li>\\n  <li><a href=\\\"https://www.workday.com/en-us/legal/responsible-ai-and-bias-mitigation.html\\\">Workday & HiredScore: Compliance and Bias Mitigation</a></li>\\n</ul>\\n\",\n  \"plain_text_body\": \"Highlights\\n- Sophos Launches Workspace Protection to Secure Hybrid and Remote Work Environments (Published 2026-01-20)\\nSophos introduced Workspace Protection, an AI-driven solution targeting security risks in distributed, hybrid, and remote working models—environments central to the Workday client base. By embedding adaptive endpoint security and real-time threat response, this solution raises the standard for security integrations demanded by modern HR SaaS deployments. Workday clients and Deloitte teams must focus on ensuring that security strategies evolve with the spread of agentic AI and remote work. https://siliconangle.com/2026/01/20/sophos-introduces-workspace-protection-simplify-hybrid-remote-work-security\\n\\n- Docebo Acquires 365Talents to Expand AI-driven Skills Intelligence (Published 2026-01-20)\\nDocebo's acquisition of 365Talents, an AI-powered skills mapping platform, boosts its stance against Workday Skills Cloud by offering deeper AI-driven talent intelligence, upskilling, and personalized mobility. This ratchets up competition and highlights the need for Deloitte teams to emphasize Workday's core strengths while preparing for client scenarios that involve external AI skills solutions alongside Workday. https://markets.ft.com/data/announce/detail?dockey=600-202601200630BIZWIRE_USPRX____20260120_BW961187-1\\n\\n- e& and IBM Announce Enterprise-Grade Agentic AI for Governance and Compliance (Published 2026-01-19)\\nIBM’s partnership with e& launched a compliance and governance-focused suite of agentic AI solutions. This places responsibility, auditability, and risk management at the forefront of agentic AI deployments for regulated clients. Deloitte's Workday practitioners must prioritize embedding responsible AI governance to remain a step ahead of client and regulatory demands. https://newsroom.ibm.com/2026-01-19-e-and-ibm-unveil-enterprise-grade-agentic-AI-to-transform-governance-and-compliance\\n\\nCompetitive Watch\\n- Docebo: Acquisition of 365Talents sharpens skills intelligence edge, challenging Workday. Deloitte teams must clarify Workday Skills Cloud advantages and integration flexibility.\\n- IBM: Leads with governance-first agentic AI, targeting regulated sectors. Deloitte should accelerate responsible AI enablement for Workday clients.\\n- Sophos: Raises hybrid/remote SaaS security expectations with AI-driven adaptive protection; Deloitte must make HR platform security core to every engagement.\\n\\nEnablement\\n- Workday Skills Cloud Capabilities: https://www.workday.com/en-us/products/human-capital-management/skills-cloud.html\\n- Responsible AI Governance in Enterprise SaaS: https://www.workday.com/en-us/legal/responsible-ai-and-bias-mitigation.html\\n- Securing Hybrid Work: https://siliconangle.com/2026/01/20/sophos-introduces-workspace-protection-simplify-hybrid-remote-work-security\\n\\nActions for Next Week\\n- Update advisory and demo materials on competitive AI-driven skills tools.\\n- Organize responsible AI and regulatory risk workshops using IBM’s agentic AI approach as a benchmark.\\n- Ensure hybrid security controls are part of ongoing client transformations.\\n- Refresh Deloitte enablement on AI, security, and skills trends.\\n\\nRisks & Mitigations\\n- Market share risk from advanced competitors (Docebo/365Talents): Mitigate by proactively differentiating Workday's native skills offerings and integration paths.\\n- Compliance risk in agentic AI deployments: Mitigate with embedded responsible AI assessments and controls in all programs.\\n- Security vulnerabilities in distributed SaaS: Mitigate via adaptive security frameworks and closer security-partner alignment.\\n\\nAll Sources\\n- Sophos introduces Workspace To support its high rental volumes, Avis needed a better way to manage vehicle operations, planning, and maintenance. The company moved to Oracle Fusion Cloud Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Oracle Fusion Cloud Enterprise Performance Management (EPM). In doing so, it gained greater visibility into and data around fleet vehicle purchases and associated costs—the company’s largest expense. This new capability applies machine learning algorithms to employee data, giving managers and executives a new tool to evaluate employee flight risk and identify and address reasons contributing to employee turnover. [...] “Dayforce HCM has consistently ranked as the leading Leader in our Human Capital Management Value Matrix,” says Brent Skinner, Principal Analyst at Nucleus Research. “This is thanks to Ceridian’s commitment to innovation as they bring full HCM into a single application, with a single dataset governed by a single rules engine. The addition of Predictive Analytics will give Dayforce users the ability to unlock the power of that single dataset for all of HCM. We expect that users will find this new functionality furthering their ability lower costs, boost productivity, improve employee engagement, and reduce turnover.”\n\nFor more information about Predictive Analytics and the entire Dayforce HCM platform, visit www.ceridian.ca.\n\n## You may also like:\n\nView All\n\n Why Dayforce?",

      "content": "a week ago   - last edited   a week ago\n\nIn today’s digital workplace, employees expect HR services to be fast, transparent, and easy to access. Traditional HR models that rely on emails, spreadsheets, and manual coordination often lead to delays and frustration. This is where Human Resource Service Delivery (HRSD) plays a crucial role.\n\nHRSD helps organizations modernize HR operations by delivering employee services through a single, unified platform.\n\n## What is Human Resource Service Delivery (HRSD)?\n\nHuman Resource Service Delivery (HRSD) is a structured approach to delivering HR services efficiently using automation, workflows, and self-service capabilities.\n\nWith ServiceNow HRSD, employees can: [...] With ServiceNow HRSD, employees can:\n\n Submit HR requests\n Access HR knowledge articles\n Track request status\n Communicate with HR teams\n\nInstead of employees searching for the right HR contact, HRSD provides one central channel for all HR-related needs.\n\n## Why HRSD is Important for Organizations\n\nHRSD directly impacts both employee experience and business productivity.\n\nKey benefits include:\n\n Improved employee engagement\n Faster HR case resolution\n Reduced manual effort for HR teams\n Better collaboration across HR, IT, Finance, and Facilities\n Consistent and compliant HR service delivery\n\nWhen HR services are simple and reliable, employees spend less time following up and more time focusing on their core responsibilities.\n\n## Real-Life HRSD Use Case\n\nPayroll Query Example [...] ### Lifecycle Events\n\nHRSD automates employee lifecycle processes that span multiple departments.\n\nExamples\n\n Employee onboarding\n Leave of absence\n Offboarding\n\nAutomation improves consistency and reduces manual follow-ups.\n\n### HR Integrations\n\nHRSD integrates with external systems to synchronize data and actions.\n\nExamples\n\n HRMS / HCM systems\n Background verification tools\n E-signature platforms\n\n### HR Performance Analytics\n\nProvides dashboards and KPIs such as:\n\n Active HR cases\n Case resolution time\n Open backlog trends\n\nThese insights help HR leaders make data-driven decisions.\n\n### Document Management & Mobile Access\n\nHRSD enables Improving service, offering employees 24/7 automated support for common HR issues\n2. Reducing agent workload, empowering your HR staff to focus on more meaningful work\n3.       "title": "Principal Advisor, ServiceNow Employee Experience and HR Service Delivery (HRSD) Solutions , San Diego | ServiceNow Careers",
      "content": "# Principal Advisor, ServiceNow Employee Experience and HR Service Delivery (HRSD) Solutions. Role description: Principal Advisor, ServiceNow Employee Experience and HR Service Delivery (HRSD) Solutions. This role is a functional and technical expert consulting with corporations on their digital transformation journey powered by implementing ServiceNow’s Employee Service Management Solutions, which includes HR Service Delivery (HRSD), and Workplace/Facility Service Delivery (WSD) solutions. This Advisor role will be the SME within ServiceNow Expert Services (who provide product expertise, in partnership with ServiceNow Product Management), providing expert advisory and building strong executive client relationships within the framework of a strategic program or project with ServiceNow implementing these solutions. * Serve as primary executive point-of-contact on projects, focused on improvements in the client’s Human Resources and Workplace organizations using ServiceNow’s Employee Service Management, HRSD, and WSD Solutions. * Understand customer requirements in collaboration with ServiceNow Expert Services and align them with ServiceNow Expert Services, Product Excellence, Customer Success, and Client Sales Teams to drive high-value impact for the Client in a roadmap for the current engagement, and the Client’s roadmap beyond it. * Align Client to defined roadmap and report/monitor ongoing progress against it, managing client executives and stakeholders – in partnership with ServiceNow Expert Services – to mitigate blockers to drive success, keeping the in-progress engagement on track. * Define, at a solution and design level of detail, technical and functional solutions aligned with our client’s business problems and ServiceNow Implementation Best Practices, providing options with pros, cons, and risks. * Build and nurture strong, trusted advisory relationships with client executives and stakeholders in the client’s Human Resources and Workplace organizations, facilitating effective communication and collaboration between their corporation and ServiceNow. * Advocate for the continuous improvement and adoption of ServiceNow Employee Service Management and HR Service Delivery (HRSD) Solutions. * 10+ years of management consulting experience or equivalent role repeatedly championing/implementing ServiceNow HR Service Delivery (HRSD) with various organizations.       "content": "Amazon Bedrock Agents manages the collaboration, communication, and task delegation behind the scenes. By enabling agents to work together, you can achieve higher task success rates, accuracy, and enhanced productivity. In internal benchmark testing, multi-agent collaboration has shown marked improvements compared to single-agent systems for handling complex, multi-step tasks. [...] With the fully managed multi-agent collaboration capability on Amazon Bedrock, specialized agents work within their domains of expertise, coordinated by a supervisor agent. The supervisor breaks down requests, delegates tasks, and consolidates outputs into a final response. For example, an investment advisory multi-agent system might include agents specialized in financial data analysis, research, forecasting, and investment recommendations. Similarly, a retail operations multi-agent system could handle demand forecasting, inventory allocation, supply chain coordination, and pricing optimization. This new capability allows you to tackle more intricate, multi-step workflows and scale your AI-driven applications more effectively. [...] This release also introduces agent monitoring and observability features, helping you track, monitor, and optimize agent interactions more efficiently. These features improve debugging and traceability, ensuring better visibility into agent workflows and making troubleshooting easier for developers.\n\nMulti-agent collaboration on Amazon Bedrock is now available in all AWS Regions where Amazon Bedrock is supported. To learn more about this feature and how it can help you build more sophisticated AI applications, see the Amazon Bedrock product page or refer to the documentation for detailed information on getting started. [...] Amazon Bedrock multi-agent collaboration GA introduces key enhancements designed to improve scalability, flexibility, and operational efficiency. Inline Agents allow you to dynamically adjust agent roles and behaviors at runtime, making workflows more adaptable as your business needs evolve. With Payload Referencing, supervisor agents can reference linked data instead of embedding it in every request, reducing data transfer, improving response times, and lowering operational costs. Additionally, multi-agent now offers CloudFormation (CFN) and Cloud Development Kit (CDK) support so you can create reusable teams of agents as templates that can be shared across accounts within an organization.",

AWS said the supervisor agent “handles the coordination, like breaking up and routing tasks to the right agents, giving specific agents access to the information they need to complete their work and determining what actions can be processed in parallel.” [...] AWS first introduced agentic capabilities in 2023 with the release of Agents on Bedrock, which offered enterprises a way to start building agents.       "content": "> “_With AgentCore, we can easily develop and test our solutions using different Python frameworks, giving us flexibility and faster experimentation,_” said Xihui Wang, Reply Data Scientist. “_The built-in gateway enables us to securely integrate Lambda functions as tools while also making them reusable across multiple agents. In addition, AgentCore provides built-in memory management, observability, and identity services, which reduce development overhead and simplify scaling to production._“ [...] Reply partnered with Totemia to develop an Offer Agent built on Strands SDK and hosted on AgentCore Runtime. The solution leverages AgentCore Gateway to invoke AWS Lambda functions generating dynamic SQL queries via Amazon Bedrock foundation models (Anthropic Claude) based on client criteria. These functions connect to Amazon RDS to fetch real-time offers and return the top 5 matches. AgentCore Memory enables multi-turn conversations, refining recommendations based on previous interactions. When no exact match exists, the agent proactively suggests adjusting criteria through iterative refinement. AgentCore Identity via Amazon Cognito provides authentication, while AgentCore Observability tracks performance and reliability. [...] AgentCore’s ready-to-use building blocks eliminated custom infrastructure development, enabling Reply to move from prototyping to production rapidly. The agent narrows results from 60 to 5-10 tailored recommendations, achieving 65% reduced search time, 40% increased bookings, 24/7 availability, 25% conversion growth, and supporting 30,000 users monthly—projecting 200-300% ROI within year one.\n\nConclusion\n\nThese early-adopter success stories demonstrate how AWS Partners are capitalizing on AgentCore to deliver transformative value across industries – from financial services to travel, security to banking.       "title": "Workday uses Google Cloud AI to accelerate document processing | Google Cloud Blog",
      "content": "Incorporating Procurement DocAI’s multi-language support into Workday applications means faster innovation for customers to support their global deployments. Expanding languages to include French, German, and Spanish enables Workday to extend the reach of its solution to serve more customers around the world. It also offers higher data accuracy in data extraction, with an F1 score1 (measure of model’s accuracy) of > 85% for receipts, enabling a high level of satisfaction. Additional support in Workday for other languages and more documents like supplier invoices is in the near future.\n\nThe partnership between Google Cloud and Workday is just one of the latest examples of how we’re providing AI-powered solutions to solve business problems. [...] Workday provides enterprise cloud applications for finance and human resources. Their in-house expense receipt parsing functionality needed to scale for international customers in multiple languages.\n\nWorkday leverages Google Cloud’s Procurement DocAI machine learning solution to automate the processing of receipts with multi-language support as a key component of its expense receipt scanning capability. This partnership delivers data capture at scale, enabling Workday customers to gain deeper insights (e.g., fraud detection) and find new opportunities to keep their businesses moving forward. [...] “At Workday, we believe enterprise software should simplify how organizations manage finance, HR, and planning. Google Cloud’s Procurement DocAI, combined with our document processing machine learning models, enables streamlined receipt intake for our customers at global scale.” - Shane Luke, VP Machine Learning & AI, Workday",

      "url": "https://investor.workday.com/2025-11-19-Workday-Expands-Its-Open-Ecosystem-with-New-Global-Developer-Network-and-Google-BigQuery-Partnership",
      "title": "Workday Expands Its Open Ecosystem with New Global Developer Network and Google BigQuery Partnership - Nov 19, 2025",
      "content": "# Workday Expands Its Open Ecosystem with New Global Developer Network and Google BigQuery Partnership. *Google BigQuery Becomes the Newest Workday Data Cloud Partner, Offering Secure, Zero-Copy Access to Trusted HR and Finance Data*. (NASDAQ: WDAY), the enterprise AI platform for managing people, money, and agents, today introduced a new global developer network that opens access to Workday AI tools and training, helping people around the world learn, build, and certify new skills. The company also announced Google Cloud as the newest partner to join Workday Data Cloud, giving customers a secure, zero-copy way to bring Workday HR and finance data to BigQuery for AI-powered insights. \"With the launch of our global developer network and Google BigQuery joining Workday Data Cloud, we're opening our ecosystem in ways that meaningfully expand what's possible for customers,\" said Gerrit Kazmaier, president of product and technology, Workday. \"When more people can access Workday's trusted data, tools, and AI, organizations can move faster, unlock new insights, and drive real business results.\". To grow the next wave of AI talent, Workday is launching a global developer network that opens access to Workday Build, giving a broader community of learners the opportunity to develop, certify, and apply Workday skills. **Google BigQuery Joins Workday Data Cloud**. Through the partnership, customers will get direct, zero-copy access to their Workday HR and finance data within Google Cloud, including BigQuery and BigLake. Customers will also be able to bring insights generated in Google Cloud, including AI-driven predictions like customer churn risk, back into Workday to inform decisions and drive better outcomes. Google Cloud joins ecosystem partners Databricks, Salesforce, and Snowflake to give customers even more ways to securely combine Workday's data with the tools they already use. \"Connecting the Workday Data Cloud with BigQuery and our market-leading Gemini models will give customers faster, more flexible access to critical business data,\" said Andi Gutmans, VP and GM, Data Cloud, Google Cloud. \"By combining Workday's trusted HR and finance data with Google Cloud's leading analytics and AI capabilities, customers can build intelligent agents to streamline their operations and drive smarter and more timely decisions with confidence.\".",

      "url": "https://www.deloitte.com/lu/en/our-thinking/future-of-advice/securing-large-language-models.html",
      "title": "Securing Large Language Models: From threat to trust",
      "content": "### Future of Advice Blog\n\n### Deloitte AI Institute Luxembourg\n\n### Future of Advice Blog\n\n### Deloitte AI Institute Luxembourg\n\n### Future of Advice Blog\n\n### Deloitte AI Institute Luxembourg\n\n### Technology careers\n\n### Deloitte Luxembourg Alumni\n\n### Technology careers\n\n### Deloitte Luxembourg Alumni\n\n### Technology careers\n\n### Deloitte Luxembourg Alumni\n\n### Technology careers\n\n### Deloitte Luxembourg Alumni\n\n### Technology careers\n\n### Deloitte Luxembourg Alumni\n\n### Technology careers\n\n### Deloitte Luxembourg Alumni\n\nSelect your location\n\nNo results found\n\nIf we have selected the wrong experience for you, please change it above.\n\n# Securing Large Language Models: From threat to trust\n\n## A practical framework for securing AI\n\nAuthors:\n\n##### To the point [...] Effective defense depends on layered countermeasures. Technical controls begin with secure system prompt design, explicitly instructing models to reject override and role-confusion attempts. This should be reinforced with input and output filtering to detect injection patterns before they reach production. Architectural controls focus on sandboxing and least privilege. Field experience consistently shows that AI security fails when fundamentals are ignored: rigorous Identity and Access Management (IAM) and cloud configuration remain are non-negotiable prerequisites.\n\nTo build trust, organizations should take the following actions: [...] deloitte_logo\ndeloitte_logo\n\n### Together makes progress\n\n### Our history\n\n### Together makes progress\n\n### Our history\n\n### Together makes progress\n\n### Our history\n\n### Together makes progress\n\n### Our history\n\n### Together makes progress\n\n### Our history\n\n### Together makes progress\n\n### Our history\n\n### Together makes progress\n\n### Our history\n\n### Generative AI services\n\n### Operate services\n\n### Generative AI services\n\n### Operate services\n\n### Generative AI services\n\n### Operate services\n\n### Generative AI services\n\n### Operate services\n\n### Future of Advice Blog\n\n### Deloitte AI Institute Luxembourg\n\n### Future of Advice Blog\n\n### Deloitte AI Institute Luxembourg\n\n### Future of Advice Blog\n\n### Deloitte AI Institute Luxembourg\n\n### Future of Advice Blog",
      "score": 0.019585585,
      "raw_content": null
    },
    {
      "url": "https://www.deloitte.com/uk/en/Industries/financial-services/research/regulatory-outlook/investment-management-and-wealth.html",
      "title": "Investment management and wealth",
      "content": "Supervisors will expect AI use in TS to be governed as a material risk, with clear accountability, explainable decisions, and robust evidence of positive customer outcomes. This will require strong data governance, proactive bias detection, transparent disclosure of AI use to retail investors, and access to a human advisor where concerns arise. Ongoing effective model testing and continuous monitoring will also be essential to ensure AI systems can identify vulnerable customers and respond effectively to changing circumstances. See our AI and data op-ed for further details. [...] ##### Endnotes [...] Source: ESMA, data correct as of 12/11/20254\n\nAll firms will need to consider how innovation can support offerings. Artificial Intelligence (AI) is expected to be a key enabler in delivering TS, particularly through data analysis, market segmentation, and scaling personalised content for investors. In parallel, firms must understand and manage the risks AI exacerbates – including data and algorithmic bias – that could lead to investor harm.",

    {
      "url": "https://www.workday.com/en-us/legal/responsible-ai-and-bias-mitigation.html",
      "title": "Workday & HiredScore's Focus on Compliance and Bias Mitigation | Workday US",
      "content": "criterion, weighted more heavily than any other criterion, or overrule conclusions from human decision-making at our customer’s organization. Nonetheless, Workday (and HiredScore, prior to Workday’s acquisition of HiredScore) routinely conducts bias testing of its AI products that have the potential to significantly impact individuals’ economic opportunities. While Workday engaged an external consultant to conduct the bias testing of the Spotlight AI tool using the impact ratio approach as described in the NYC Law, the purpose of this testing is in furtherance of Workday/HiredScore’s commitments to identify and mitigate potential bias. Customers may need to conduct their own evaluation, testing and/or bias audits depending on their legal obligations. [...] HiredScore’s explainable AI outputs report to what extent a candidate’s application matches the job requirements using a simple A, B, C, D system, where A denotes the highest match between a candidate’s application and an employer-defined job requisition. Put another way, the technology acts like a “smart mirror” reflecting back the extent to which candidates fit the job requirements set by the employer. The A, B, C, D scores are never “curved.” This means that if a job requisition has commonly held requirements, there may be many more As and Bs than Cs and Ds. Conversely, if a job requisition has very uncommonly held requirements, there may be many more Cs and Ds than As and Bs, and each candidate will receive a score indicating how they align with the requirements; this score is [...] Designing and building responsible AI that our customers can trust and adopt in line with their legal compliance obligations has been part of HiredScore’s mission statement since the beginning. We take responsible AI very seriously and regularly work with outside experts in AI, data privacy, employment law, and responsible AI to ensure adherence to best practices and the highest standards.\n\n## Overview of HiredScore AI Functionality",
      "score": 0.7031221,

      "title": "Using the AI Risk Management Framework - NIST EEOC says Workday must face claims that AI software is biased Addressing AI bias: a human-centric approach to fairness - EY Judge allows Workday AI bias lawsuit to proceed as collective ... Responsible AI Practices | Workday US Responsible AI: Ensuring T...",
      "content": "When Workday uses an AI tool that we have either developed or procured from a third-“As business leaders begin their AI journey, many are looking for a roadmap for how to develop and use AI in a way that is responsible and innovative. At Workday, we’ve found the NIST AI Risk Management Framework to be a concrete benchmark for mapping, measuring, and managing our approach to AI governance. We believe the Framework will help us maintain our customers’ trust and stay true to our company’s core values as we leverage it to innovate going forward”. Jim Stratton, Chief Technology Officer, Workday party and interacts with end-users, we are an AI deployer. [...] With AI best practices and technical standards continuing to mature, the AI RMF is an essential benchmark for AI developers and deployers. Workday uses the AI RMF to assess and refine our responsible AI practices and to communicate the rigor of our AI governance approach to our enterprise customers. With leaders in the U.S., Europe, Canada, Singapore, and elsewhere taking action to promote trustworthy AI, the AI RMF is a common language to understand the expectations and requirements of AI governance. [...] Building a responsible AI questionnaire to assess the third-party AI tools that Workday procures from other AI developers. By evaluating various aspects of AI development, implementation, and usage, this questionnaire helps Workday align third-party tools with our ethics principles and risk management priorities.\nWith AI legal requirements, best practices, and technical standards maturing, Workday will continue using the AI RMF as a reference point for how we assess, refine, and strengthen our approach to AI governance.",

      "url": "https://blogs.oracle.com/oraclehcm/oracle-cloud-hcm-vs-workday-5-things-to-know",
      "title": "Oracle Cloud HCM vs. Workday: 5 things to know | oraclehcm",
      "content": "Given that Workday’s 24 R2 release is scheduled for September 2024, it should just barely make its own timeline.\n\nMeanwhile, Oracle Cloud HCM made a clear announcement regarding its generative AI plans and use cases in June 2023. As of its first release in 2024, Oracle Cloud HCM customers have had access to embedded generative AI functionality that help customers improve decision making and enhance the employee experience. These include knowledgebase articles, job postings, performance feedback and development tips, and review summaries. It also includes many use cases that Workday has not announced on its roadmap, like a candidate experience summary, job category landing pages, and job match explanations. [...] Then co-CEO Carl Eschenbach first discussed preliminary plans for generative AI in March 2023. Workday’s generative AI use cases were clarified at Workday Rising in September 2023, talking about functionality such as job descriptions and employee growth plans. Plans for availability were set for 6-12 months from the event, or between March and September 2024. As of March 2024, Workday confirmed that there were three HCM use cases in an early adopter program as of its 24 R1 release, with none scheduled for general availability until the 24 R2 release or later. Workday subsequently put a fourth HCM use case into early adopter program during its DevCon 2024 event, with no clear plans for general availability. [...] Overall, Workday only has 25 generative AI use cases on its roadmap, while Oracle Fusion Applications have 50+ embedded use cases.\n\nThe innovation comparison is substantial. While Oracle Cloud HCM customers are benefiting from increased productivity, Workday users are made to wait.\n\n## 4. Deliver a personalized and meaningful experience to every employee",

    {
      "url": "https://blog.workday.com/de-de/vertrauen-durch-design-wie-workday-ki-baut-die-menschen-in-den-mittelpunkt-stellt.html",
      "title": "Vertrauen durch Design. Wie Workday KI baut, die ...",
      "content": "## Governance und Aufsicht\n\nVerantwortungsvolle KI braucht mehr als gute Absichten. Sie braucht klare Governance-Strukturen und verbindliche Verantwortlichkeiten. Bei Workday ist die Aufsicht über KI-Systeme fest in unserer Arbeitsweise verankert. Mit klar definierten Rollen, strukturierten Prüfprozessen und aktiver Einbindung der Führungsebene.\n\nUnser internes Responsible AI Advisory Board tagt regelmäßig, um das Programm für verantwortungsvolle KI zu begleiten. Dazu gehören auch neue Funktionen und Anwendungsfälle. Zusätzlich überwacht der Vorstand von Workday den Einsatz neuer Technologien. Darunter generative und agentische KI. Diese Strukturen sorgen gemeinsam dafür, dass KI bei Workday durchdacht, konsistent und im Einklang mit unseren Werten entwickelt und eingesetzt wird. [...] Entscheidend ist: Die Kontrolle bleibt stets bei unseren Kunden. Hiring Manager und Recruiting-Teams entscheiden selbst, wie sie KI-gestützte Erkenntnisse nutzen. Dieser menschenzentrierte Ansatz ist bewusst gewählt. Er stellt sicher, dass Technologie verantwortungsvoll, transparent und mit Respekt gegenüber Bewerbenden wie Arbeitgebern eingesetzt wird.\n\n## Unabhängig geprüft, weltweit anerkannt\n\nWorkday verlangt kein blindes Vertrauen. Unser Rahmenwerk für verantwortungsvolle KI wurde freiwillig einer strengen, unabhängigen Prüfung durch Dritte unterzogen und an international anerkannte Standards angepasst. [...] Seit vielen Jahren verfolgt Workday einen proaktiven, unternehmensweiten Ansatz für verantwortungsvolle KI. Dieses Engagement reicht von der Produktentwicklung über Governance-Strukturen bis hin zu operativen Prozessen. Dahinter steht eine klare Haltung: Vertrauen muss eingebaut werden. Es lässt sich nicht im Nachhinein ergänzen.\n\n## Menschenzentriert von Grund auf\n\nWorkday unterstützt Organisationen dabei, ihre wichtigsten Ressourcen zu steuern. Ihre Menschen und ihre Finanzen. Von Recruiting und Gehaltsabrechnung über Workforce Planning bis hin zu Buchhaltung und darüber hinaus. Diese Verantwortung nehmen wir seit dem ersten Tag ernst. Entsprechend entwickeln wir Technologien, die auf Vertrauen, Wirksamkeit und Verantwortlichkeit ausgelegt sind.",
      "score": 0.7711725,
      "raw_content": null
    },

      "content": "### Financial Services\n\nSingapore’s MAS continues to set the region’s benchmark for responsible AI, emphasising fairness, explainability, and auditable decisioning.5 But this shift extends well beyond Singapore. Philippine banks are adopting AI to strengthen fraud detection and credit scoring. Malaysian financial institutions are modernising under Bank Negara’s risk governance standards. Globally, PwC estimates banking AI spend is projected to rise from US$6B in 2024 to about US$85B by 2030, and AI could generate US$2T in new banking value by 2028, increasing profitability by ~9% for early adopters.6\n\n### Insurance [...] Boomi AI  Lead agentic transformation\n Boomi Agentstudio  Design, govern and orchestrate AI agents\n AI Agents  Deploy AI agents for rapid automation\n Boomi MCP  Deliver agent-ready tools with enterprise governance\n Responsible AI  Enterprise-grade security and governance for agentic transformation\n\nAll Connectors Boomi for SAP    Oracle NetSuite\n\nExplore Boomi Marketplace Connect Any Application Connect with NetSuite Connect with Snowflake Connect with ChatGPT Connect with ServiceNow Connect with Shopify Connect with Google Drive Retrieval-Augmented Generation with Boomi [...] MIT’s “State of AI in Business 2025” found that 95% of organisations struggle to generate meaningful ROI from AI, largely due to weak data foundations and integration gaps. The same study revealed a significant governance gap: 90% of employees use AI tools informally, while only 40% of organisations officially support them, creating unmanaged operational risk.1\n\nBoomi and FT Longitude’s “Navigating the AI Agent Governance Gap” report reinforces this urgency: just 2% of organisations have fully accountable AI agents, and nearly 80% lack visibility or control over agent behaviour.2",

Acting as co-workers and autonomous economic actors, they reshape work, markets, and accountability. Business models shift toward Intelligence-as-a-Service, capability marketplaces, and algorithmic organizations. While AI boosts agility and scalability, it raises governance, transparency, and ethical challenges. [...] AI sovereignty is becoming a defining competitiveness and security worldwide as AI increasingly underpins critical infrastructure, industrial innovation, and economic growth. At the same time, enterprises operate in global value chains and rely on cross-border AI capabilities, cloud ecosystems, and international standards.​ [...] This roundtable, will discuss how AI is empowering cyber defenders to achieve secure outcomes and help enhance resilience, close the skills gap, and establish global standards for responsible innovation.​\n\nParticipants:\n\n Jay Chaudhry, Founder/CEO, Zscaler\n George Krutz, Founder/CEO, Crowdstrike\n Michael J Daniels, CEO, Cyber Threat Alliance\n Belisario Contreras, Senior Director, Global Security and Technology Strategy @ Venable & ED DigiAmerica Alliances\n Mark Hughes, Global Cyber Leader, IBM\n Robert Lee, Founder/CEO, Dragos\n Gary Marcus, Founder, Robust.ai ​\n\nModerator: Akhilesh Tuteja, Head of Clients and Industries, KPMG in India\n\n16:00 – 17:00\n\nKPMG Lounge, Belvedere Hotel\n\nFemale Leaders event: Turning feedback into focus​",

    {
      "url": "https://blog.workday.com/de-de/vertrauen-durch-design-wie-workday-ki-baut-die-menschen-in-den-mittelpunkt-stellt.html",
      "title": "Vertrauen durch Design. Wie Workday KI baut, die ...",
      "content": "In diesem Kontext entsteht KI bei Workday mit einem klaren Ziel: Menschen zu unterstützen, nicht sie zu ersetzen. Das ist besonders im Recruiting von zentraler Bedeutung. Unsere KI trifft keine Einstellungsentscheidungen. Sie lehnt keine Bewerbungen automatisch ab und entscheidet nicht darüber, wer eine Stelle erhält. Stattdessen hilft sie Recruiterinnen, Recruitern und Hiring-Teams dabei, Prozesse mit hohem Volumen effizienter zu steuern, relevante Informationen sichtbar zu machen und administrative Aufgaben zu reduzieren. So bleibt mehr Zeit für fachliche Expertise und menschliches Urteilsvermögen bei Einstellungsentscheidungen. [...] Diese Überzeugung prägt unseren KI-gestützten, menschenzentrierten Ansatz in der Technologieentwicklung. Die KI-Funktionen von Workday sind darauf ausgelegt, Kunden, ihre Mitarbeitenden und Bewerbende zu unterstützen. Sie eröffnen Chancen, liefern klare und verantwortungsvolle Erkenntnisse und stärken die menschliche Entscheidungsfindung, statt sie zu ersetzen. Von der Konzeption unserer Systeme bis zu ihrer Steuerung und ihrem Einsatz gilt: Vertrauen ist kein nachträglicher Zusatz. Es ist von Anfang an Teil des Designs. [...] ## Governance und Aufsicht\n\nVerantwortungsvolle KI braucht mehr als gute Absichten. Sie braucht klare Governance-Strukturen und verbindliche Verantwortlichkeiten. Bei Workday ist die Aufsicht über KI-Systeme fest in unserer Arbeitsweise verankert. Mit klar definierten Rollen, strukturierten Prüfprozessen und aktiver Einbindung der Führungsebene.\n\nUnser internes Responsible AI Advisory Board tagt regelmäßig, um das Programm für verantwortungsvolle KI zu begleiten.       "content": "We are looking for an experienced Principal Software Engineer to work on our Advanced Apps team with focus on enhancing and managing connectors to SaaS applications e.g., Workday, Salesforce, GCP, AWS, etc. They will work closely with the Lifecycle Management (LCM) team that provides a platform for automating Joiner, Mover, Leaver processes. The same product with the same features is now called Customer Experience Insights, or CX Insights for short.\n\nDataplex\n\nBreaking [...] Document AI\n\nFeature\n\nDocument AI is introducing document-level prompting for custom document processors. This feature allows you to provide an overall description of the document to inject deep business knowledge into the model, leading to improved extraction quality.\n\nDocument-level prompting offers improved accuracy by giving the model necessary context for extraction at the document level. This allows for easily supplied general information, such as geographical limitations (for example, _all the address fields are located in the USA_), to guide the model.\n\nFor more details, refer to the documentation on custom extractor mechanisms and document-level prompting.\n\nGemini Enterprise\n\nAnnouncement\n\nAgent Designer is generally available (GA).\n\nGoogle SecOps\n\nFeature [...] Dataflow\n\nFeature\n\nDataflow now serves a notice for when the Dataflow Runner v2 container image of a streaming pipeline will be upgraded.     {
      "url": "http://mckinsey.com/capabilities/tech-and-ai/our-insights/superagency-in-the-workplace-empowering-people-to-unlock-ais-full-potential-at-work",
      "title": "AI in the workplace: A report for 2025 | McKinsey",
      "content": "Even those with a skeptical take on AI are familiar with it; 94 percent of Gloomers and 71 percent of Doomers say they have some familiarity with gen AI tools. Furthermore, approximately 80 percent of Gloomers and about half of Doomers say they are comfortable using gen AI at work.\n\nExhibit \n\nImage 9: Employee segments differ, but all indicate a high familiarity with gen AI.\n\nImage descriptions begins:\n\nThe exhibit depicts US employee sentiment toward gen AI, categorized into four archetypes: Doomer, Gloomer, Bloomer, and Zoomer. Each archetype's perspective is presented through a series of semicircular sunray charts showing the share of respondents within each group holding specific views. [...] Image description ends.\n\n### Leaders can invest more in their employees\n\nShare\n\nSidebar\n\nWho is using AI at work? Nearly everyone, even skeptical employees\n\nOur research looked at people who self-identify as “Zoomers,” “Bloomers,” “Gloomers,” and “Doomers” in their attitudes toward AI—a set of archetypes introduced in _Superagency_. We find that 39 percent of employees identify as Bloomers, who are AI optimists that want to collaborate with their companies to create responsible solutions. Meanwhile, 37 percent identify as Gloomers, who are more skeptical about AI and want extensive top-down AI regulations; 20 percent identify as Zoomers, who want AI to be quickly deployed with few guardrails; and just 4 percent identify as Doomers, who have a fundamentally negative view of AI (exhibit). [...] AI is the latest in a series of transformative supertools, including the steam engine, internet, and smartphone, that have reshaped our world by amplifying human capabilities. Like its predecessors, AI can democratize access to knowledge and automate tasks, assuming humans can develop and deploy it safely and equitably.",
      "score": 0.15870851,
      "raw_content": null

    {
      "url": "https://blog.workday.com/de-de/vertrauen-durch-design-wie-workday-ki-baut-die-menschen-in-den-mittelpunkt-stellt.html",
      "title": "Vertrauen durch Design. Wie Workday KI baut, die ...",
      "content": "In diesem Kontext entsteht KI bei Workday mit einem klaren Ziel: Menschen zu unterstützen, nicht sie zu ersetzen. Das ist besonders im Recruiting von zentraler Bedeutung. Unsere KI trifft keine Einstellungsentscheidungen. Sie lehnt keine Bewerbungen automatisch ab und entscheidet nicht darüber, wer eine Stelle erhält. Stattdessen hilft sie Recruiterinnen, Recruitern und Hiring-Teams dabei, Prozesse mit hohem Volumen effizienter zu steuern, relevante Informationen sichtbar zu machen und administrative Aufgaben zu reduzieren. So bleibt mehr Zeit für fachliche Expertise und menschliches Urteilsvermögen bei Einstellungsentscheidungen. [...] Diese Überzeugung prägt unseren KI-gestützten, menschenzentrierten Ansatz in der Technologieentwicklung. Die KI-Funktionen von Workday sind darauf ausgelegt, Kunden, ihre Mitarbeitenden und Bewerbende zu unterstützen. Sie eröffnen Chancen, liefern klare und verantwortungsvolle Erkenntnisse und stärken die menschliche Entscheidungsfindung, statt sie zu ersetzen. Von der Konzeption unserer Systeme bis zu ihrer Steuerung und ihrem Einsatz gilt: Vertrauen ist kein nachträglicher Zusatz. Es ist von Anfang an Teil des Designs. [...] ## Governance und Aufsicht\n\nVerantwortungsvolle KI braucht mehr als gute Absichten. Sie braucht klare Governance-Strukturen und verbindliche Verantwortlichkeiten. Bei Workday ist die Aufsicht über KI-Systeme fest in unserer Arbeitsweise verankert. Mit klar definierten Rollen, strukturierten Prüfprozessen und aktiver Einbindung der Führungsebene.\n\nUnser internes Responsible AI Advisory Board tagt regelmäßig, um das Programm für verantwortungsvolle KI zu begleiten. Dazu gehören auch neue Funktionen und Anwendungsfälle. Zusätzlich überwacht der Vorstand von Workday den Einsatz neuer Technologien. Darunter generative und agentische KI. Diese Strukturen sorgen gemeinsam dafür, dass KI bei Workday durchdacht, konsistent und im Einklang mit unseren Werten entwickelt und eingesetzt wird.",

      "url": "https://kpmg.com/xx/en/what-we-do/industries/private-enterprise/venture-pulse/asia.html",
      "title": "Asia: Q4'25 Venture Pulse Report",
      "content": "AI remained a central focus for VC investment in Asia during Q3’25, with China attracting the largest share of capital. The quarter’s biggest raises included GLP ($348 million), a data center infrastructure developer, and MiniMax AI ($300 million), which specializes in text-to-video AI. In addition, smartphone-focused AI agent developer Z.ai secured $139 million, underscoring the diversity of AI applications gaining traction in China. [...] ## Deal volume remains subdued — except for D+ rounds\n\nDeal volume in Asia has been quite subdued this year, with numbers well off pace of 2024’s totals across most deal stages at the end of Q3’25. D+ deals were the exception, with deal volume well-positioned to see a modest increase year-over-year should trends continue through Q4’25, although average deal value was substantially lower. The increase in deal volume likely reflects the rapid maturation of startups in Asia — particularly in areas like AI and deeptech, and in jurisdictions like Japan, India, and Indonesia — and the growing number of companies raising later funding rounds. [...] Standout raises this quarter included Newmo (¥17.9B), and Terra Charge (¥10.4B). Hot sectors continue to be AI, healthcare, energy, space, and mobility, though polarization is clear: proven companies and large VC funds are thriving, while smaller funds and weaker startups face bigger hurdles.\n\n## Trends to watch for in Q4’25\n\nHeading into Q4’25, VC investment in Asia will likely remain subdued, particularly in China where economic recovery is expected to take some time. AI and deeptech will likely remain a top priority for investors across the region, in addition to areas like health and biotech.",
      "score": 0.026802607,

      "content": "이 에이전트는 직무 설명 작성, 후보자 소싱, 인터뷰 스케줄링 등의 태스크를 간단히 해결하는 것은 물론 후보자 프로필에 관한 AI 기반의 인사이트를 제공합니다. Microsoft Teams와 같은 커뮤니케이션 플랫폼과도 통합됩니다.\n\nWorkday의 새로운 글로벌 인재 동향 및 채용 트렌드 리포트에 의하면, AI 기반의 채용 어시스턴트 기능은 적합한 인재 발견이 점점 더 힘들어질 때 특히 진가를 발휘합니다.\n\n새로운 Expenses 에이전트는 AI를 활용하여 경비보고서를 자동으로 생성하고 제출합니다. 이를테면 출장 중인 직원이 조식 결제를 완료하는 즉시 영수증을 업로드하라는 문자 메시지를 받습니다. 그러면 시스템에서 영수증을 신용카드 거래와 매칭하여 자동으로 경비 라인을 생성합니다.\n\nSuccession 에이전트는 조직 차원에서 미래의 리더를 찾고 성장시키도록 돕습니다. 매니저가 승계 계획을 업데이트하도록 미리 알려주고, 조직의 전 범위에서 승계자를 자동으로 추천하고, 핵심 인재를 위한 맞춤형 개발 계획을 만들어 다음에 맡을 역할을 준비할 수 있게 합니다.\n\n마지막으로 Optimize 에이전트는 Workday의 비즈니스 프로세스를 능률화합니다. 병목 지점, 비효율성, 모범 사례와의 차이점을 밝혀냅니다. 이를테면 온보딩 프로세스의 문제점(예: 수동 데이터 입력, 순서가 맞지 않는 단계)에 자동으로 플래그를 지정하고 해결할 수 있습니다. [...] Bhusri는 기술 업계가 AI를 둘러싼 장밋빛 전망의 정점을 지나고 있으며 'AI가 실질적인 비즈니스 가치를 제공하는 것이 관건'임을 인정했습니다. Workday는 10여 년 전부터 AI에 투자하면서 생성형 AI 기능, Workday Extend 내 AI Gateway, Workday AI 마켓플레이스 등을 내놓았습니다.\n\nWorkday Illuminate는 Workday가 진행 중인 AI 로드맵이 진일보한 결과이며, 현실의 다양한 시나리오에서 그 가치를 발휘할 것입니다.\n\nBhusri는 AI가 매니저 경험을 혁신하는, 즉, 매니저가 팀에서 최고의 인재를 빠르게 발견하고 성장시키도록 지원하는 HR 환경에 관해 설명했습니다.\n\n그는 청중에게 모든 비즈니스 트랜잭션의 생성, 검증, 회계 처리가 사실상 비대면으로 이루어지고 계정이 셀프 조정되는 환경을 상상해 보라고 말했습니다.\n\n또한 Workday의 지난 화요일 발표에 의하면, Workday는 대표적인 AI 기반 문서 인텔리전스 플랫폼, Evisort를 인수하기 위한 최종 계약을 체결했습니다.       "content": "### Do AI agents replace human workers or just assist them?\n\nOur AI agents are designed to augment human workers, not replace them. The primary goal of Workday agents is to free your people to focus on higher-value work, such as strategic analysis and complex problem-solving, where human skills are most impactful.\n\n### Are AI agents available out of the box in Workday or fully customizable? [...] ### How can I be sure I’m getting value from AI agents?\n\nWorkday Agent System of Record provides deep agent analytics and clear visibility into the ROI you’re getting from each agent. This ensures you have the data to prioritize the AI capabilities that are delivering the most value.\n\n### What steps should companies take to get started with AI agents?\n\nStart by identifying high-impact business processes or employee friction points where agents can add the most value. Next, enable existing AI features you already have through Workday to complement and enhance agent capabilities. Finally, prepare your organization by equipping your workforce to interact with AI, including developing new skills, adapting workflows, and fostering a culture of collaboration with AI agents.       "url": "https://www.deloitte.com/uk/en/Industries/financial-services/research/regulatory-outlook/artificial-intelligence-and-data.html",
      "title": "Artificial intelligence and data",
      "content": "### AstraZeneca is digitising the patient experience Story\n\n       Consumer\n       Energy, Resources & Industrials\n       Financial Services\n       Government & Public Services\n       Life Sciences & Healthcare\n       Private Equity\n       Technology, Media & Telecommunications\n\n### AstraZeneca is digitising the patient experience Story\n\n       Adobe\n       Anaplan\n       Apple\n       AWS\n       Google\n       Informatica\n       Mulesoft\n       Oracle\n       Salesforce\n       SAP\n       ServiceNow\n       UiPath\n       Workday\n       Workiva\n\n### AstraZeneca is digitising the patient experience Story\n\n### AstraZeneca is digitising the patient experience Story\n\n### AstraZeneca is digitising the patient experience Story\n\n### AstraZeneca is digitising the patient experience Story [...] This raises expectations for boards and senior executives. They will need a clear, actionable risk appetite for AI, setting boundaries on where it can be used, acceptable levels of autonomy, and how outcomes are monitored and tested. Effective oversight depends on knowing where AI is deployed, the materiality of each use case, and how performance, incidents and limitations are reported. Boards will need reliable management information on AI performance and risks, and the ability to challenge assumptions, test management confidence, and ensure that AI remains within risk tolerances. They must also be confident that executives can act decisively when issues arise, with clear escalation routes, defined responsibilities, robust controls, and credible plans for pausing AI systems if necessary. [...] Responsibility for AI governance across FS remains uneven, with some exceptions.Oversight is often driven by first line functions or led by Chief Data Officers or Chief Information Officers, whose focus naturally leans towards technical performance. This can mean regulatory and risk considerations receive less attention than they should. More effective models distribute governance across technology, risk and compliance, ensuring a balanced view of performance, safety and regulatory obligations. While accountability may sit in different parts of the organisation depending on each firm’s structure, those accountable should ensure that AI risks are managed in line with regulatory expectations and agreed risk tolerances.",

      "title": "AI in the workplace: A report for 2025 | McKinsey",
      "content": "AI is the latest in a series of transformative supertools, including the steam engine, internet, and smartphone, that have reshaped our world by amplifying human capabilities. Like its predecessors, AI can democratize access to knowledge and automate tasks, assuming humans can develop and deploy it safely and equitably. [...] Chapter 2\n\nEmployees are ready for AI; now leaders must step up and C-suite leaders (99 percent) report having some level of familiarity with gen AI tools. Nevertheless, business leaders underestimate how extensively their employees are using gen AI. C-suite leaders estimate that only 4 percent of employees use gen AI for at least 30 percent of their daily work, when in fact that percentage is three times greater, as self-reported by employees (Exhibit 2). And while only a total of 20 percent of leaders believe employees will use gen AI for more than 30 percent of their daily tasks within a year, employees are twice as likely (47 percent) to believe they will (see sidebar “Who is using AI at work? Nearly everyone, even skeptical employees”). [...] Many breakthrough technologies, including the internet, smartphones, and cloud computing, have transformed the way we live and work. AI stands out from these inventions because it offers more than access to information. It can summarize, code, reason, engage in a dialogue, and make choices. AI can lower skill barriers, helping more people acquire proficiency in more fields, in any language and at any time. AI holds the potential to shift the way people access and use knowledge. The result will be more efficient and effective problem solving, enabling innovation that benefits everyone.\n\nShare\n\nSidebar\n\nAI superagency",

Policymakers, keen to foster innovation and growth, are expanding sandboxes and industry collaborations to support safe AI use. However, as adoption grows, 2026 will likely bring firmer supervisory scrutiny. As AI becomes more deeply embedded in core business processes and decision-making, supervisors will look for rigorous testing, comprehensive documentation, measurable outcomes, and board-level accountability. The AI agenda connects directly to operational resilience and the growing reliance on third-party providers, themes explored further below. [...] Despite regional differences, regulators globally share a common goal: to foster innovation without diluting risk-based oversight. The core principle is that new capabilities, including Generative or agentic AI, must not override sound risk management. Firms can adopt AI quickly, provided they invest in essential capabilities and safeguards: a clear risk appetite, strong internal controls, robust risk management, and, crucially, accountability for outcomes.\n\n#### Operational resilience – efficiency meets reality",

    {
      "url": "https://www.deloitte.com/lu/en/our-thinking/future-of-advice/securing-large-language-models.html",
      "title": "Securing Large Language Models: From threat to trust",
      "content": "For data protection, encrypt sensitive inputs before submission, apply anonymization or federated learning where feasible, and enforce strict access controls on vector databases. Finally, establish AI-specific incident response procedures, including playbooks for model manipulation, data-poisoning detection, and rapid rollback of compromised models.       "title": "KPMG at the World Economic Forum in Davos",
      "content": "AI is redefining how organizations create, coordinate, and capture value. Acting as co-workers and autonomous economic actors, they reshape work, markets, and accountability. Business models shift toward Intelligence-as-a-Service, capability marketplaces, and algorithmic organizations. While AI boosts agility and scalability, it raises governance, transparency, and ethical challenges. The same product with the same features is now called Customer Experience Insights, or CX Insights for short.\n\nDataplex\n\nBreaking [...] Document AI\n\nFeature\n\nDocument AI is introducing document-level prompting for custom document processors. This feature allows you to provide an overall description of the document to inject deep business knowledge into the model, leading to improved extraction quality.\n\nDocument-level prompting offers improved accuracy by giving the model necessary context for extraction at the document level. This allows for easily supplied general information, such as geographical limitations (for example, _all the address fields are located in the USA_), to guide the model.\n\nFor more details, refer to the documentation on custom extractor mechanisms and document-level prompting.\n\nGemini Enterprise\n\nAnnouncement\n\nAgent Designer is generally available (GA).\n\nGoogle SecOps\n\nFeature [...] Dataflow\n\nFeature\n\nDataflow now serves a notice for when the Dataflow Runner v2 container image of a streaming pipeline will be upgraded.       "url": "https://kpmg.com/xx/en/what-we-do/industries/private-enterprise/venture-pulse/asia.html",
      "title": "Asia: Q4'25 Venture Pulse Report",
      "content": "AI remained a central focus for VC investment in Asia during Q3’25, with China attracting the largest share of capital. The quarter’s biggest raises included GLP ($348 million), a data center infrastructure developer, and MiniMax AI ($300 million), which specializes in text-to-video AI. In addition, smartphone-focused AI agent developer Z.ai secured $139 million, underscoring the diversity of AI applications gaining traction in China. [...] ## Deal volume remains subdued — except for D+ rounds\n\nDeal volume in Asia has been quite subdued this year, with numbers well off pace of 2024’s totals across most deal stages at the end of Q3’25. D+ deals were the exception, with deal volume well-positioned to see a modest increase year-over-year should trends continue through Q4’25, although average deal value was substantially lower. The increase in deal volume likely reflects the rapid maturation of startups in Asia — particularly in areas like AI and deeptech, and in jurisdictions like Japan, India, and Indonesia — and the growing number of companies raising later funding rounds. [...] Standout raises this quarter included Newmo (¥17.9B), and Terra Charge (¥10.4B). Hot sectors continue to be AI, healthcare, energy, space, and mobility, though polarization is clear: proven companies and large VC funds are thriving, while smaller funds and weaker startups face bigger hurdles.\n\n## Trends to watch for in Q4’25\n\nHeading into Q4’25, VC investment in Asia will likely remain subdued, particularly in China where economic recovery is expected to take some time. AI and deeptech will likely remain a top priority for investors across the region, in addition to areas like health and biotech.",

    {
      "url": "http://mckinsey.com/capabilities/tech-and-ai/our-insights/superagency-in-the-workplace-empowering-people-to-unlock-ais-full-potential-at-work",
      "title": "AI in the workplace: A report for 2025 | McKinsey",
      "content": "AI is the latest in a series of transformative supertools, including the steam engine, internet, and smartphone, that have reshaped our world by amplifying human capabilities. Like its predecessors, AI can democratize access to knowledge and automate tasks, assuming humans can develop and deploy it safely and equitably. [...] Chapter 2\n\nEmployees are ready for AI; now leaders must step up and C-suite leaders (99 percent) report having some level of familiarity with gen AI tools. Nevertheless, business leaders underestimate how extensively their employees are using gen AI. C-suite leaders estimate that only 4 percent of employees use gen AI for at least 30 percent of their daily work, when in fact that percentage is three times greater, as self-reported by employees (Exhibit 2). And while only a total of 20 percent of leaders believe employees will use gen AI for more than 30 percent of their daily tasks within a year, employees are twice as likely (47 percent) to believe they will (see sidebar “Who is using AI at work? Nearly everyone, even skeptical employees”). [...] Many breakthrough technologies, including the internet, smartphones, and cloud computing, have transformed the way we live and work. AI stands out from these inventions because it offers more than access to information. It can summarize, code, reason, engage in a dialogue, and make choices. AI can lower skill barriers, helping more people acquire proficiency in more fields, in any language and at any time. AI holds the potential to shift the way people access and use knowledge. The result will be more efficient and effective problem solving, enabling innovation that benefits everyone.\n\nShare\n\nSidebar\n\nAI superagency",
      "score": 0.1477644,
      "raw_content": null

      "url": "https://www.wsj.com/business/media/american-pop-culture-history-ce8672f1",
      "title": "The Rise and Fall of the American Monoculture",
      "content": "For most of the 20th century, they were also the glue that held the country together. In a sprawling nation founded on the precept of individual liberty and populated primarily by immigrants from around the world, there was hardly one American experience. Maids in Boston, factory workers in Chicago and farmers in California lived much different lives despite being part of the same country.\n\nCinemas, radios, television sets and records changed all that. Americans might do different things during the workday, but at night and on weekends, we were watching and listening to the same things—things made in America, primarily for Americans, by the first modern celebrities.\n\nCopyright ©2026 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.     {
      "url": "https://blog.workday.com/de-de/vertrauen-durch-design-wie-workday-ki-baut-die-menschen-in-den-mittelpunkt-stellt.html",
      "title": "Vertrauen durch Design. Wie Workday KI baut, die ...",
      "content": "In diesem Kontext entsteht KI bei Workday mit einem klaren Ziel: Menschen zu unterstützen, nicht sie zu ersetzen. Das ist besonders im Recruiting von zentraler Bedeutung. Unsere KI trifft keine Einstellungsentscheidungen. Sie lehnt keine Bewerbungen automatisch ab und entscheidet nicht darüber, wer eine Stelle erhält. Stattdessen hilft sie Recruiterinnen, Recruitern und Hiring-Teams dabei, Prozesse mit hohem Volumen effizienter zu steuern, relevante Informationen sichtbar zu machen und administrative Aufgaben zu reduzieren. So bleibt mehr Zeit für fachliche Expertise und menschliches Urteilsvermögen bei Einstellungsentscheidungen. [...] ## Governance und Aufsicht\n\nVerantwortungsvolle KI braucht mehr als gute Absichten. Sie braucht klare Governance-Strukturen und verbindliche Verantwortlichkeiten. Bei Workday ist die Aufsicht über KI-Systeme fest in unserer Arbeitsweise verankert. Mit klar definierten Rollen, strukturierten Prüfprozessen und aktiver Einbindung der Führungsebene.\n\nUnser internes Responsible AI Advisory Board tagt regelmäßig, um das Programm für verantwortungsvolle KI zu begleiten. Dazu gehören auch neue Funktionen und Anwendungsfälle. Zusätzlich überwacht der Vorstand von Workday den Einsatz neuer Technologien. Darunter generative und agentische KI. Diese Strukturen sorgen gemeinsam dafür, dass KI bei Workday durchdacht, konsistent und im Einklang mit unseren Werten entwickelt und eingesetzt wird. [...] Diese Überzeugung prägt unseren KI-gestützten, menschenzentrierten Ansatz in der Technologieentwicklung. Die KI-Funktionen von Workday sind darauf ausgelegt, Kunden, ihre Mitarbeitenden und Bewerbende zu unterstützen. Sie eröffnen Chancen, liefern klare und verantwortungsvolle Erkenntnisse und stärken die menschliche Entscheidungsfindung, statt sie zu ersetzen. Von der Konzeption unserer Systeme bis zu ihrer Steuerung und ihrem Einsatz gilt: Vertrauen ist kein nachträglicher Zusatz. Es ist von Anfang an Teil des Designs.",

      "content": "AI is the latest in a series of transformative supertools, including the steam engine, internet, and smartphone, that have reshaped our world by amplifying human capabilities. Like its predecessors, AI can democratize access to knowledge and automate tasks, assuming humans can develop and deploy it safely and equitably. [...] Conclusion: Meeting the AI future\n\nChapter 1\n\nAn innovation as powerful as the steam engine. This is the transformative potential of AI, a technology with a potential impact poised to surpass even the biggest innovations of the past, from the printing press to the automobile. AI does not just automate tasks but goes further by automating cognitive functions. Unlike any invention before, AI-powered software can adapt, plan, guide—and even make—decisions. That’s why AI can be a catalyst for unprecedented economic growth and societal change in virtually every aspect of life. It will reshape our interaction with technology and with one another. [...] Many breakthrough technologies, including the internet, smartphones, and cloud computing, have transformed the way we live and work. AI stands out from these inventions because it offers more than access to information. It can summarize, code, reason, engage in a dialogue, and make choices. AI can lower skill barriers, helping more people acquire proficiency in more fields, in any language and at any time. AI holds the potential to shift the way people access and use knowledge. The result will be more efficient and effective problem solving, enabling innovation that benefits everyone.\n\nShare\n\nSidebar\n\nAI superagency",

    {
      "url": "https://blog.workday.com/de-de/vertrauen-durch-design-wie-workday-ki-baut-die-menschen-in-den-mittelpunkt-stellt.html",
      "title": "Vertrauen durch Design. Wie Workday KI baut, die ...",
      "content": "In diesem Kontext entsteht KI bei Workday mit einem klaren Ziel: Menschen zu unterstützen, nicht sie zu ersetzen. Das ist besonders im Recruiting von zentraler Bedeutung. Unsere KI trifft keine Einstellungsentscheidungen. Sie lehnt keine Bewerbungen automatisch ab und entscheidet nicht darüber, wer eine Stelle erhält. Stattdessen hilft sie Recruiterinnen, Recruitern und Hiring-Teams dabei, Prozesse mit hohem Volumen effizienter zu steuern, relevante Informationen sichtbar zu machen und administrative Aufgaben zu reduzieren. So bleibt mehr Zeit für fachliche Expertise und menschliches Urteilsvermögen bei Einstellungsentscheidungen. [...] Diese Überzeugung prägt unseren KI-gestützten, menschenzentrierten Ansatz in der Technologieentwicklung. Die KI-Funktionen von Workday sind darauf ausgelegt, Kunden, ihre Mitarbeitenden und Bewerbende zu unterstützen. Sie eröffnen Chancen, liefern klare und verantwortungsvolle Erkenntnisse und stärken die menschliche Entscheidungsfindung, statt sie zu ersetzen. Von der Konzeption unserer Systeme bis zu ihrer Steuerung und ihrem Einsatz gilt: Vertrauen ist kein nachträglicher Zusatz. Es ist von Anfang an Teil des Designs. [...] ## Governance und Aufsicht\n\nVerantwortungsvolle KI braucht mehr als gute Absichten. Sie braucht klare Governance-Strukturen und verbindliche Verantwortlichkeiten. Bei Workday ist die Aufsicht über KI-Systeme fest in unserer Arbeitsweise verankert. Mit klar definierten Rollen, strukturierten Prüfprozessen und aktiver Einbindung der Führungsebene.\n\nUnser internes Responsible AI Advisory Board tagt regelmäßig, um das Programm für verantwortungsvolle KI zu begleiten. Dazu gehören auch neue Funktionen und Anwendungsfälle. Zusätzlich überwacht der Vorstand von Workday den Einsatz neuer Technologien. Darunter generative und agentische KI. Diese Strukturen sorgen gemeinsam dafür, dass KI bei Workday durchdacht, konsistent und im Einklang mit unseren Werten entwickelt und eingesetzt wird.",

    {
      "url": "https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/answers/questions/5725721/attribute-or-expression-for-mapping-the-employee-h",
      "title": "Attribute or Expression for Mapping the Employee Hire Date",
      "content": "Why this is expected\n\nMicrosoft Entra ID is an identity directory, not an HR system. Employment data such as hire date typically lives in systems like:\n\nWorkday\n\nSAP SuccessFactors\n\nOther HRIS platforms\n\nThat data only appears in Entra ID if you explicitly sync or write it there.\n\nSupported and recommended options\n\n1: Use a custom attribute\n\nIf your hire date comes from an HR system or is manually maintained:\n\nStore it in a custom Entra ID attribute, for example:\n\nextension\\_<appId>\\_hireDate\n\nor extensionAttribute1–15 (if synced from on-premises AD)\n\nMap that custom attribute directly to Okta using Okta’s attribute mapping or expressions\n\nThis is the most common and supported approach.\n\n2: Use employeeHireDate\n\nYou can map employeeHireDate only if: [...] employeeHireDate exists but must be explicitly written to\n\nThere is no default expression to derive hire date in Entra ID\n\nBest practice is to store hire date in a custom Entra attribute sourced from HR and map that to Okta.\n\nPlease refer this\n\nI Hope this helps. Do let me know if you have any further queries.\n\nThank you!\n\n' cx='32' cy='32' r='32' /%3E%3Ctext x='50%25' y='55%25' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' fill='%23FFF' %3ESC%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E)\n\nHi Rimesh,\n\nDid you get any chance to review the above response. Do let me know if you have any further queries.\n\nThank you!\n\n## Your answer\n\n## Additional resources\n\n### Question activity\n\n### Additional resources [...] This browser is no longer supported.\n\nUpgrade to Microsoft Edge to take advantage of the latest features, security updates, and technical support.\n\n#### Share via\n\n# Attribute or Expression for Mapping the Employee Hire Date\n\n' cx='32' cy='32' r='32' /%3E%3Ctext x='50%25' y='55%25' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' fill='%23FFF' %3ER%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E)\n\nI'm looking to map the Employee hire date from Entra to Okta and unable to locate the correct attribute or expression. Anyone successfully mapped this field from Entra\n\n' cx='32' cy='32' r='32' /%3E%3Ctext x='50%25' y='55%25' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' fill='%23FFF' %3EAV%3C/text%3E%3C/svg%3E)\n\nHi Rimesh,",

      "content": "The surge in AI investment was not confined to the U.S. and Europe. In Canada, Cohere raised $600 million, while in China, MiniMax AI closed a $300 million round. Highlights included U.S.-based Sierra ($350 million), a developer of AI-powered customer service agents; China-based GLP ($348 million) and Runhui Technology Development ($256 million), both focused on AI-driven data center development; Sweden-based Lovable ($200 million), which enables AI-enhanced web and app development; and Canada-based Blue J ($122 million), a legal research platform leveraging AI. [...] ## AI remains the top priority for VC investors\n\nVC investors globally continued to double down on AI in Q3’25, with companies developing AI models and platforms attracting many of the largest funding rounds of the quarter. In addition to the blockbuster $1 billion-plus raises by Anthropic, xAI, and Mistral, New York–based Reflection AI secured $1 billion, reinforcing the sustained appetite for transformative AI bets. [...] Together, these transactions illustrate that AI remains the defining theme in global VC, attracting capital at scale across geographies and use cases — from foundational models and infrastructure to applied vertical solutions.       "title": "Asia: Q4'25 Venture Pulse Report",
      "content": "AI remained a central focus for VC investment in Asia during Q3’25, with China attracting the largest share of capital. The quarter’s biggest raises included GLP ($348 million), a data center infrastructure developer, and MiniMax AI ($300 million), which specializes in text-to-video AI. In addition, smartphone-focused AI agent developer Z.ai secured $139 million, underscoring the diversity of AI applications gaining traction in China. [...] ## Deal volume remains subdued — except for D+ rounds\n\nDeal volume in Asia has been quite subdued this year, with numbers well off pace of 2024’s totals across most deal stages at the end of Q3’25. D+ deals were the exception, with deal volume well-positioned to see a modest increase year-over-year should trends continue through Q4’25, although average deal value was substantially lower. The increase in deal volume likely reflects the rapid maturation of startups in Asia — particularly in areas like AI and deeptech, and in jurisdictions like Japan, India, and Indonesia — and the growing number of companies raising later funding rounds. [...] Standout raises this quarter included Newmo (¥17.9B), and Terra Charge (¥10.4B). Hot sectors continue to be AI, healthcare, energy, space, and mobility, though polarization is clear: proven companies and large VC funds are thriving, while smaller funds and weaker startups face bigger hurdles.\n\n## Trends to watch for in Q4’25\n\nHeading into Q4’25, VC investment in Asia will likely remain subdued, particularly in China where economic recovery is expected to take some time. AI and deeptech will likely remain a top priority for investors across the region, in addition to areas like health and biotech.",
